Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me break down the scenario into components 1 Start Service Request verification SR 2 After SR Contract Setup CS 3 After CS Two parallel tasks DA ACI 4 After both DA and ACI looped configuration phase BNC then optional DR 5 After loop Exclusive choice CD or MD 6 After choice Two tasks QA and SA concurrent 7 After both QA and SA GLA

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now I need to map this to POWL constructs Transition for labeled activities OperatorPOWL for LOOP and XOR StrictPartialOrder for partial orders

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Structure Root level StrictPartialOrder containing the main flow Main flow sequence 1 SR 2 CS 3 partial order block DA and ACI 4 loop block BNC DR 5 choice block CD MD 6 partial order block QA and SA 7 GLA

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For the concurrent DA and ACI I can either 1 Put them both in the root nodes list and add edges from CS to both and from both to the loop 2 Or group DA and ACI in a StrictPartialOrder sub node I think approach 2 is cleaner and better represents the hierarchical structure

Name: Validation - PE

Name: Validation - PE

Name: Validation - PE
